intro: Eucalyptus versicolor, commonly known as the variable gum, is a species of eucalyptus native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its variable leaf coloration, which can range from grey-green to blue-green, depending on environmental conditions. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, with smooth, peeling bark that is often grey or white. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, woody capsules as fruit. This plant is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
